review:
I recently underwent treatment for a persistent dental issue that has been causing me discomfort for months and I am delighted to share my positive experience under the care of Dr. Neha.

Dr. Neha expertise in addressing my dental concerns was truly remarkable, from my first clinical visit, she demonstrated a deep understanding of my problem, putting me at ease with her knowledge. Throughout the treatment process, Dr Neha maintained open and clear communication. She took the time to explain the details of the treatment which included sinus uplift, bone graft surgery and dental implants, ensuring that I felt well-informed and involved in decision making.

Thanks to Dr. Neha‚Äô skillful care, I experienced significant improvements in my dental condition . The persistent pain that has been troubling me for months is now alleviating, and I am grateful fot the positive outcome under her care.

Dr. Neha exceeded my expectations in every aspect of my dental care. I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Neha to anyone seeking a compassionate and skilled dental professional.

review:
When I was 78, I had problems with 11 of my front lower teeth and the doctor said that in keeping with my personality ( I looked about 58) I should go in for partial dentures of 5 and 6. Now I am 82 and had some problems with the remaining couple of teeth and my doctor has done root canaling and crown fitment so smoothly that I hardly felt that I was in any kind of pain. 
Since I was under the scalpel I don't know if she used any anesthesia.
In the end she said uncle I respect you. 
Who would not want such a treatment?
Although there was no smile involved in the treatment dental treatment is all about smiling.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: *** ****** ** **** *******  ** ***** ** ****** she works on your teeth for 10 mins. Then does her work,  comes back and tells you that another sitting will be started and you are now supposed to pay double the money **** ******* *** *** ********* **** *** ******* **** **** ***** **** * **** **** * ***** ** *** ****** ******* ** ** ******* ** ****  *******  **** ******* *** * *** *******
reply_text:
Sir/Mam
I don't know what and where was the communication gap. 
At the beginning of the treatment we explain all our patients the procedure, where specifically for scaling(professional cleaning of teeth); we convey it is charged per sitting ie ‚Çπ500 per sitting.

Number of sittings depends on the deposits in patient's mouth and a single sitting lasts approx 8-10 minutes.

Now why 8-10 minutes?? Depending upon the deposits( both amount and thickness) in patient's mouth, the piezoelectric scaler tip (instrument used to do scaling) gets heated up in 8-10 minutes. Hence we have to stop because the heated instrument can lead to sensitivity and further damage to your teeth.
